lines.text: My, Grandma. How big eyes you have?
All the better to -
[Bugs pokes Wolf's eyes hard]
EEEOOOOWWWW!
And what big ears you have?
OH YEAH? And what big ears YOU have?
And what big feet you have!
And what a big red coat you've got on!

[Takes off Wolf's disguse]
Why, Granny. You're just a wolf with cheap clothing.
AND YOU'RE NOT RED RIDING HOOD!
Oh right, smarty-pants. Since I'm not Red Riding Hood, you don't get the present I brought over.
Oh, come on! Be a good guy. Give me what ya got. Please? Huh huh? Please huh please?
Well, okay. But remember...
[Splats cake onto Wolf's face]
You asked for it!
They're home, Doc. Start blowing.
I can't blow the brick house down. It says so in the book.
Book, schnook! Blow the house down.
I'm gonna huff, and I'll puff, and I'll b-b-b-blow your house down!
Listen, it's that windy wolf.
[They laugh]
Ah, blow your brains out.
We know you can't blow down bricks.
[the wolf blows; after a moment, the house explodes]
I did it!
He did it?

[Next to a detonator]
Eh... *we* did it.
Why, Granny! You're just a wolf in cheap clothing.
I'm gonna huff, and I'll puff, and I'll...
[looks up line in book]
Oh, yeah... and I'll b-b-b-blow your house down!
Now just a minute, Doc...
[the wolf blows the wooden house down and leaves]
Of course you know, this means war.

[Reading his book]
Hmm, says here I can't blow down a brick house.

[Bugs walks by singing dressed as Little Red Riding Hood]
The rabbit in red, la da da di, the rabbit in red.
Hey kid; who are you?

[Opening Wolf's book to Little Red Riding Hood]
Here, Doc, read this.

[Reading]
One day, Little Red Riding Hood, Grandma's house, Wolf ate grandma, 'my, GRandma what big ears you have'!
[Looks at watch]
Holy cow! I haven't even taken care of Grandma yet!

[Running into Granny's house]
Alright, Grandma! Out! Get a move on! Hit the bricks, sister!
Land's sake, Wolf; ain't you goin' to eat me?
No time for that, Granny; get moving, shake a leg.
Can't a body even get her shawl on? Stop that, Wolf!
[Suitcase flies across the room, knocking Granny through the door]

[Reading his book]
Hmm, says here I can't blow down a brick house.

[Bugs walks by singing dressed as Little Red Riding Hood]
The rabbit in red/ la da da di di di/ the rabbit in red.
Hey kid; who are you?

[Opening Wolf's book to Little Red Riding Hood]
Here, Doc, read this.

[Reading quickly]
One day, Little Red Riding Hood, Grandma's house, Wolf ate grandma, 'my, GRandma what big ears you have'!
[Looks at watch]
Holy cow! I haven't even taken care of Grandma yet!

[Running into Granny's house]
Alright, Grandma! Out! Get a move on! Hit the bricks, sister!
Land's sakes, Wolfie; ain't you gonna eat me?
No time for that, Granny; get moving, shake a leg.
Can't a body even get her shawl on? Stop that, Wolf!
[Suitcase flies across the room, knocking Granny through the door]

[after completing his revenge on the wolf; to the wolf]
Serves you right. Blowing down my houses.
Not your houses. The pigs' houses. I got to do what it says in the book.

[Realizing]
Oh, I get it. It's those pigs' houses.
